instructions.text: In this first section, you'll be presented with two statements. Choose the statement you feel best represents you.
Remember, no wrong answers! If you get stuck, go with your gut!

questions.name: EitherOr1
questions.text: Select the statement you agree with the most:
questions.requiredMessage: Please select one of the two statements.

subQuestions.requiredMessage: Please select one of the two statements.

options.description: When working in a team, I encourage everyone’s participation
I try to go along with others to avoid conflict

subQuestions.requiredMessage: Please select one of the two statements.

options.description: I usually feel pretty good about what is to come in the future
I am a very expressive person. Everyone always knows what I am thinking.

questions.name: EitherOr2
questions.text: Select the statement you agree with the most:
questions.requiredMessage: Please select one of the two statements.

subQuestions.name: EO3
subQuestions.requiredMessage: Please select one of the two statements.

options.description: I often reflect on how I am feeling
I am always paying attention to what is going on around me

subQuestions.requiredMessage: Please select one of the two statements.

options.description: I usually feel that I am “in tune” with others
I stay focused on what’s going on in my own head, and don’t worry so much about other distractions

questions.name: EitherOr3
questions.text: Select the statement you agree with the most:
questions.requiredMessage: Please select one of the two statements.

subQuestions.requiredMessage: Please select one of the two statements.

options.description: I am always looking forward to the future and believe the best is yet to come
I usually feel like I am in control of my reactions

subQuestions.requiredMessage: Please select one of the two statements.

options.description: I don’t have a problem changing my priorities to deal with changing situations
Even when presented with obstacles, I push through to get things done

instructions.text: Now that you’re warmed up, we’re going to ask you some rapid-fire multiple choice questions
Go with your first instinct.  These questions help illuminate your best “human” skills, so the more honest the answer, the better culture fit you’ll find
When you’re ready, hit NEXT and let’s go!

subQuestions.name: TW1
subQuestions.text: I am the person that encourages cooperation in a team

subQuestions.name: SO2
subQuestions.text: When someone close to me is upset, it does not affect me at all

subQuestions.name: SO3
subQuestions.text: It is easy for me to figure out how someone is feeling, without them telling me

subQuestions.name: PA2
subQuestions.text: I see good in the situation instead of bad.

subQuestions.name: AO1
subQuestions.text: I try to improve myself

subQuestions.name: AO3
subQuestions.text: I strive to do a better job with whatever I do

subQuestions.name: GR2
subQuestions.text: I become obsessed with certain ideas or projects, but later lose interest

subQuestions.name: CM1
subQuestions.text: I try to resolve conflict by bringing everyone's concerns out into the open

subQuestions.name: PA1
subQuestions.text: I see opportunities instead of focusing on problems

subQuestions.name: CM3
subQuestions.text: If someone disagrees with me, I change my perspective to agree with them

subQuestions.name: CM2
subQuestions.text: When conflicts arise, I avoid confrontation

subQuestions.name: SA2
subQuestions.text: I get confused about how I am feeling

subQuestions.name: SO1
subQuestions.text: I understand how others feel by imagining how I would feel in their shoes

subQuestions.name: CO1
subQuestions.text: I offer others constructive feedback to help them develop

subQuestions.name: SC1
subQuestions.text: I lose control when I am in a high-pressure situation

subQuestions.name: CO2
subQuestions.text: I mentor others when I have the opportunity

subQuestions.name: AD1
subQuestions.text: When the rules of the game change, I change as needed

subQuestions.name: TW2
subQuestions.text: I support my team members

subQuestions.name: SC2
subQuestions.text: I maintain my composure in difficult situations

subQuestions.name: GR4
subQuestions.text: I finish whatever I begin even if I encounter challenges

subQuestions.name: AD3
subQuestions.text: I struggle when plans or goals change

subQuestions.name: SC4
subQuestions.text: I act appropriately in stressful stituations

subQuestions.name: CO3
subQuestions.text: I invest my own time to develop others

subQuestions.name: PR1
subQuestions.text: It is important to me to keep my appointments no matter what

subQuestions.name: GR1
subQuestions.text: New ideas and projects distract me from previous ones

subQuestions.name: GR3
subQuestions.text: I decide to stop working on a project to work on a new project that interests me

subQuestions.name: SA1
subQuestions.text: I know how my feelings affect my actions

subQuestions.name: AD2
subQuestions.text: I change my strategy to fit the situations

subQuestions.name: SA3
subQuestions.text: There are times I become so focused on accomplishing my work, I don't notice other things

subQuestions.name: AO2
subQuestions.text: I set goals to accomplish things

subQuestions.name: PA3
subQuestions.text: I reminisce about the past versus being excited about the future

subQuestions.name: PR2
subQuestions.text: I accept responsibility for both the good and bad outcomes of my work

subQuestions.name: PR3
subQuestions.text: I put the same amount of effort into my work, even if I know others won't see the final product

subQuestions.name: TW3
subQuestions.text: I am respectful of others' opinions when working in a team

instructions.text: Next up, we’ll present you with a work scenario and a group of accompanying statements.
You’ll need to rank those statements by how strongly you would agree or disagree with them when thinking of yourself as a leader.
The statement at the top should be what you most believe in, and the one at the bottom the least

questions.name: Leadership
questions.text: You are the manager of a team of eight employees who generally work well together. You have been supervising the team for the last 18 months.

options.text: People are competent and will do what they should if left alone
Effective leaders give orders and clarify procedures
It is fair to say most employees put in a lack of effort
As a rule, employees should be given rewards or punishments to motivate them to meet objectives
Leaders need to help subordinates accept responsibility for completing their work
I empower my team members to share their thoughts and ideas

instructions.text: You're doing great! You're almost done.
The next section is very important. It's all about learning what makes you tick!
First, in the passions section you can tell us all about the activities that motivate and inspire you. Things you 'jump out of bed' for!

After that, we'll present you with a list of core values and ask you to select those that are most important to you. When your personal values align with a company's culture...that's when magic happens!

questions.name: Passion
questions.text: Tell us what you're most passionate about. These can be things like social causes, challenging projects, mentoring, technology, etc. Feel free to tell us about three.

subQuestions.requiredMessage: Please tell us a personal passion.

questions.name: PersonalValues
questions.text: Your Core Values create a firm guide on your path to a meaningful career. We provided a list of 40 values; please select the top 20 that mean the most you. After that we’ll ask you to narrow down your choices to your 10 most important.

questions.name: CoreValues
questions.text: Great choices! Now narrow down to the top 10 that mean the most to you:
